devdoc.author: Accelerate Finance
devdoc.details: This contract is responsible for deploying and managing instances of the RBF contract.

constructor.details: Inherits from the Auth contract to implement access control.

params.deployer: The address of the entity deploying the contract, serving as the initial administrator.

newRBF((string,string,address,address,ad.details: Deploys a new implementation of RBF, a ProxyAdmin, and a TransparentUpgradeableProxy.          Transfers ownership of the proxy admin to the guardian and the RBF to the caller.

params.data: The initialization data for the RBF contract.
params.guardian: The address that will take ownership of the proxy admin.

returns._0: address   The address of the newly created RBF proxy contract.
returns._1: address   The address of the newly created proxy admin contract.
returns._2: address   The address of the newly created RBF implementation contract.

devdoc.title: RBFFactory

constructor.notice: Constructor function that initializes the contract and sets the deployer as the authorized user.

deny(address).notice: Remove user as a ward (remove admin access)

newRBF((string,string,address,address,ad.notice: Creates a new instance of the RBF contract using an upgradeable proxy.

rely(address).notice: Make user a ward (give them admin access)

wards(address).notice: Returns whether the target is a ward (has admin access)

userdoc.notice: This contract serves as a Factory for the upgradable RBF token contract.          Upon calling `newRBF` the caller address will          deploy the following:          1) RBF - The implementation contract, ERC20Upgradeable contract with the constructor disabled          2) ProxyAdmin - OZ ProxyAdmin contract, used to upgrade the proxy instance.                          Owner is set to `guardian` address.          3) TransparentUpgradeableProxy - OZ TransparentUpgradeableProxy contract, used to proxy the implementation.          Following the above mentioned deployment, the address of the RBFFactory contract will:          i) Transfer ownership of the ProxyAdmin to that of the `guardian` address.          ii) Transfer ownership of the rbfProxied to that of the msg.sender address.
